Back to Sergei Rachmaninoff

Sergei Rachmaninoff

Morceaux de fantaisie, op. 3

1892

[Wikipedia] · [IMSLP]

Total duration: 22'

  • 1. Elégie in E-flat minor
  • 2. Prélude in C-sharp minor
  • 3. Mélodie in E major
  • 3. Mélodie in E major (1940 version)
  • 4. Polichinelle in F-sharp minor
  • 5. Sérénade in B-flat minor
  • 5. Sérénade in B-flat minor (1940 version)

Recommended editions

  • Henle · HN 1256 · ed. Dominik Rahmer [with both versions of nos. 3 and 5]
  • Henle · HN 1200 · 24 Préludes · ed. Dominik Rahmer [no. 2]
  • Henle · HN 1520 · 24 Préludes · ed. Dominik Rahmer [no. 2]
  • Russian Music Publishing · 3402 · Pieces II · ed. Valentin Antipov [with both versions of nos. 3 and 5]
  • Russian Music Publishing · 3403 · 24 Préludes · ed. Valentin Antipov [no. 2]

1. Elégie in E-flat minor

Duration: 5' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

2. Prélude in C-sharp minor

Rachmaninoff arranged this piece for two pianos in 1938.

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

3. Mélodie in E major

Duration: 5'

Difficulty: 3

3. Mélodie in E major (1940 version)

This piece exists in a revised version from 1940.

Duration: 4' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

4. Polichinelle in F-sharp minor

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5

5. Sérénade in B-flat minor

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 3

5. Sérénade in B-flat minor (1940 version)

This piece exists in a revised version from 1940.

Duration: 3' 30"

Difficulty: 3.5
